venue.name: Harvard Law School, Ames Courtroom, Austin Hall

item.description:
Berkman Center for Internet & Society

Open House

Note: This event is at Pound Hall, Room 102, Harvard Law School. I won't be there. Have fun. (S.)

Attend the Berkman Center for Internet & Society's Open House to meet Berkman faculty, fellows, and staff and to learn about the many ways you can get involved and learn with their dynamic, exciting environment.

As a University-wide research center at Harvard University, their interdisciplinary efforts in the exploration of cyberspace address a diverse range of backgrounds and experiences. If you're interested in the Internetâ€™s impact on society and are looking to engage a community of world-class fellows and faculty through events, conversations, case studies, and more please join them to hear more about the upcoming academic year!

Paid research assistant positions are also available in the fall. In addition to Berkman courses and events, these positions provide a wonderful way to join their community. People from all disciplines and universities are encouraged to attend the Open House to learn about Berkman opportunities.

As a primer, visit their website to see currently available positions.

More information here
.


Tuesday, September 8, 7:00 pm
Pound Hall Room 102, Harvard Law School
Followed by a reception at the Berkman Center's offices, 23 Everett Street, Second Floor
Free and Open to the Public
item.name: Berkman Center for Internet & Society: Open House
